info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 19 at 3:20PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of western Rutherford, northeastern Henderson and southeastern Buncombe Counties through 345 PM EDT... At 320 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles southeast of Downtown Asheville, or near Fairview In Buncombe County, moving southeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Arden, Fletcher, Fairview In Buncombe County, Chimney Rock Village, Chimney Rock State Park, Bat Cave, Asheville Airport, B.R. Parkway-Nc Arboretum To East Asheville, Skyland and Lake Lure. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
